original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares slip on profit taking
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on profit taking as the previous sessions gains have boosted confidence in investors, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.57 percent or 58.23 points to 10,117.90, S&P SL20 was down 1.25 percent or 37.79 points to 2,975.58
Top losers during mid day trade were Commercial Bank, Hatton National Bank and Sampath Bank, as debt restructuring assurances channeled profit taking and selling interest. (Colombo/July06/2023)
